name: Art And Music 1 Quiz | Humanities | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Leonardo.

	Leonardo da Vinci was a Florentine artist who painted the portrait around 1495-1497.

Gainsborough.

	He was a English painter. It is now in the Huntington collection.

questions.text: What famous artist is said to have founded the Cubist movement?
questions.explanation:
Pablo Picasso.

	He was a Spanish painter whose style of painting was described as being made of little cubes.

questions.text: What composer wrote the opera 'The Magic Flute'?
questions.explanation:
Mozart.

	He was Austrian and an accomplished clavier, violin aand organ player.

questions.text: Which artist was famous for his portrayal of the music halls and cafes of Montmartre?
How many semitones are there in an octave?
questions.explanation:
12.

	An octave actually contains 12 pitches a semitone apart.

questions.text: What type of singing voice is Jon Vickers known for?

questions.explanation:
Wood.

	He was an American painter 1892-1942. It was painted in 1930.
